result.title: Small scale validation report
result.description:
This deliverable will report on the laboratory based validation of batch and continuous sensor solutions as a preparation for inclusion in the live processes. Performance and parameters that will reported will include:
- High temperatures influence - Impulse and pressure (mechanical) - Radio performance (Electromagnetic)

result.title: Industrial Process Discovery Document
result.description: This deliverable will survey the type and perpose of all the sensory data in the DISIRE application driven use cases. This sensory servey will be combined with the existing control strategies and systems in order to define the processes and the product state data needed for implementing engineering and statistical process control.

result.title: Modeling and process control architectures for data-driven MPC
result.description: This deliverable will focus on the definition and design of a smooth and consistent modeling and control design workflow that is amenable for data-driven adaptation of MPC from PAT. Moreover the performance indicators for the related product quality and energy efficiency will also be reported.

result.title: Benchmark specifications and related performance measures for expected Impact
result.description: Based on the defined application scenarios and desired impact goals of DISIRE, this deliverable will focus in creating a strategy for evaluating the capabilities of each of the DISIRE subcomponents, ending with the final benchmark of the project. The deliverable will contain specifications on: - Specification of advanced inline sensing - Specification of PAT analysis - Specification on PAT based IPC - Process specific demonstration specifications

result.title: Report on batch sensor design solutions
result.description: This deliverable will report the developments in the area of sensors and electronics in batch processes and more specifically in the area of non-contact high speed industrial fibre optic infrared sensing. The applicability, manufacturability and initial lab and extended industrial tests will be also be reported.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: As DISIRE will participate in the limited action on open access to research data in H2020, a Data Management Plan (DMP) will be developed describing the data management life cycle for all data sets that will be collected. More details the DMP will specify what data the project will generate, whether and how it will be exploited or made accessible for verification and re-use, and how it will be curated and preserved.

result.title: Report on end-user requirements, and regulations
result.description: The detailed specifications for the further integration of the DISIRE components generated form WP2-4 into the adopted industrial processes and their full operability will be further specified in this task. The specification documents will be process specific and the effort will be to further extend the functionalities and the implementation limitations of the pure scientific initial results in the project in the industrial demonstrations of the subcomponents in TRL levels 3-5.

result.title: Application scenarios and demonstration activities specifications
result.description: This deliverable will analyze and specify in detail the identified DISIRE application scenarios and impact goals, based on the collected and integrated information from the end-user reports on the existing inline measurements, PAT analysis and IPC concepts. Existing methods in the form of state of the art and further expected DISIRE capabilities and characteristics will be further investigated in relation with the applicability of the examined scenarios and the overall TRL demonstration levels that could be achieved.

result.title: Sensor technology selection report
result.description: This deliverable will report on the survey for identifying the physical quantities being critical to be measured in the defined DISIRE application scenarios. The goal will be to identify shortcomings of existing sensor technology and identify needs for research towards new types of measurements, as well as to identify application for sensor technology previously not used in continuous industrial process control.

result.title: Base Case Description – Instrumenting the pellet transportation chain
result.description: This deliverable will report on experiments that are designed to study the flow behaviour of larger PAT sensor platforms in silos and transports. The contacted experiments will evaluate the proposed DISIRE based PAT sensing technologies while tuning the sensory design parameters and features.

result.title: Report of suitable O2 sensors for cracking furnaces characteristics
result.description: This deliverable will report the activities being performed for the characterisation of sensors and conditions for oxygen measuring in a cracking furnace. The CFD study will be further presented for achieving further optimization in the sensing technologies as well as calculating the most efficient point for optimizing the furnace operation.
